alert.note: Alert for Central and Southeast Phillips; Garfield; Petroleum; Southwest Phillips (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 4:04PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Phillips, northeastern Petroleum and west central Garfield Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 403 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles south of Zortman to 13 miles south of Crooked Creek Rec Area. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Crooked Creek Rec Area, U L Bend Rec Area and Cat Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
